statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 4 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 9 \\ -12 \\ -3 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -15 \\ 20 \\ 5 \\ 20 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 4 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 9 \\ -12 \\ -3 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -15 \\ 20 \\ 5 \\ 20 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
